value.0: Greetings <Brother/Sister>, it is good to see you here in Kohlingen.  How may I assist you?
Certainly.  What would you like to know?

How noble of you.  Alas, I have no reward to give you for such a thing.  But if you seek to help us, you could venture to the Beastman Caves.  Foul deeds have been whispered to be happening, yet we have not the manpower to send the Everguard to investigate.  The Kohlingen Guard and Soldiery are busy defending from the raids.  A counter-attack from yourself might throw them off-guard long enough for us to mount a war party.
These statues are reminders to us of two of the greatest heroes to ever grace the Order.  They serve to inspire greatness in us from the lore of their deeds.

To the right is the likeness of Sir Nuen.  Although he was not the most skilled warrior, his lesson is a valuable one.  Sir Nuen was known for his charity and self-deprivation.  It is a hard lesson, and many young Paladins see this as a great obstacle.

Sir Nuen never kept more gold or items than were needed to survive.  He never wore expensive armors or had powerful magical aids.  He felt these were a sign of vanity and made a warrior reliant on worldly things instead of his steadfast faith.  He epitomizes the warrior that believes he will overcome, not because of sheer power, but from an unbendable will.

To the left is Sir Freyden of Chaucel.  He was one of the founding members of the Order, most renowned for sacrificing his own self to heal and aid  others during the thickest of combats.  He fell in battle honorably, after ensuring escape for his fellows at the cost of his own life.  We learn the lesson of selflessness from Sir Freyden, and the monument to him reinforces it to us daily.

The Everguard are the Holiest of warriors, sworn to protect the Keep.  Only Paladin's of great standing are ever admitted to the Order.  Even then, most are required to stay here to defend this place eternally.  It is not for the slight of heart nor for the aimless.

This is the Kohlinger Keep, the last bastion of goodness. Epic battles have been fought on what is now the City of Kohlingen.  We must always remember the countless templars that fought to keep its walls ever standing.
Our numbers have risen over the years.  Yet again there are champions who serve with noble hearts.

Alas, you cannot ask.  But know that my eyes are ever-watchful, and if a Paladin virtuous and true you are, I will eventually seek you out.  Be warned however, such an honor comes with a burdenous load and an eternal service to the Keep
Of course, I would be happy to offer you a selection of worthy aids.  May they serve you well.
I seek no assistance, fare thee well.
I've just come to make my pilgrimage, can you tell me of this place?
Nothing.  I'll be going now.
How can I help the cause?
I am not up to that task, I shall see where else I am needed.
I would be glad to, however I have some more questions.
Excellent!  I shall investigate this immediately!
Who are represented by these statues behind you?
Who is the statue to the right?
Go on.
Thank you for the lesson, but I must be on my way now.
Incredible.  I have more questions, however.
Who is the statue to the left?
Truly inspiring, but I must take my leave.
Magnificent.  I have more questions.
Who are these Everguard?
Thank you, I should be going now.
I see.  I still have more questions.
What is this place?
Go on.
I must take my leave.
I have some more questions.
How can I join?
I shall heed your warning and take my leave.
I understand.  I have some more questions.
I need equipment to aid me on the quest.
Actually, I changed my mind.  I'd rather just ask you a few questions.
Thank you.
